from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

test_df = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
# Drop irrelevant columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent column order
train_columns = train_df.columns
test_columns = test_df.columns
common_cols = train_columns.intersection(test_columns)

# Reconstruct dataframes with common columns
train_df = train_df[common_cols]
test_df = test_df[common_cols]

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop('Survived', axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Split data (stratified)
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_scaled, y, test_size=0.2, stratify=y, random_state=42)

# Train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(random_state=42, max_iter=1000)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(test_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
test_ids = test_df['PassengerId']
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_ids,
    'Survived': y_pred
})

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent column order by using set intersection
common_cols = set(train_df.columns) & set(test_df.columns)
train_df = train_df[common_cols]
test_df = test_df[common_cols]

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop('Survived', axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Split data (stratified)
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_scaled, y, test_size=0.2, stratify=y, random_state=42)

# Train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(random_state=42, max_iter=1000)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(test_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
test_ids = test_df['PassengerId']
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_ids,
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop irrelevant columns
train_df = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
train_df['Fare'].fillna(train_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure consistent columns
common_cols = train_df.columns.intersection(test_df.columns)
train_df = train_df[common_cols]
test_df = test_df[common_cols]

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop('Survived', axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)
test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Split data (stratified)
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_scaled, y, test_size=0.2, stratify=y, random_state=42)

# Train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(random_state=42, max_iter=1000)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(test_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
test_ids = test_df['PassengerId']
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_ids,
    'Survived': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
